dialog.text: I used to chase calm, until I started journaling my mood every morning.
What did you actually write down?
A simple templateâ€”mood 1-10, energy 1-10, sleep quality, and one line about today.
Yes. I noticed low sleep often came with low mood, while noting small wins helped lift the next day.
Journaling becomes a map, not a verdict.
Give it a week. Write daily, review weekly, and adjust what you track.
If you try it, remember: journaling is a map, not a verdict. Share your first insight in the comments.
